channel.title: My comp wont let me do "ULTIMATE SERVER GUIDE" PLEASE HELP MEH!
channel.description:
Next, you will need to open ports in Windows Firewall and/or the firewalls offered by McAffee, Norton, or other full-system maintenance suites. For Windows Firewall, open its settings file in the control panel. Click on the "Exceptions Tab" and then click "Add Port." Add the following port: 43594. (If you'd rather not open a specific port or have to worry about Windows Firewall disabling access in any way, you can disable it entirely.)
[size=20pt]Ok, I have done this, Easy. :)[/size]
Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always
[size=20pt]Ok, a few problems here. 1.I dont know my routers IP adress and it doesent say it 2. Type it in where? :confused: [/size]
KEY 1 = Any name you want the server to be (I.E.MyScape).[/glow] 2 = The IP adddress of your COMPUTER; not the Internet. Then save it. Ok now you can save settings after the rule is saved. Every router is different. Check with the manuals for yours to fully understand how to open the ports. If you cannot find/have a manuel, go to this address:
Port Forwarding
Now your server rule is nice and good. Now we need Java to get your server's compiler and runserver to work. You can download the newest java at this link:
JDK 6.0
Ok before we can fix the compiler and runeserver, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.
start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables
[size=20pt]I dont have "system" in my control panel :S[/size] [br][size=1]Posted at: December 19, 2006, 06:25:35 PM[/size][hr]HELP ME SOMEONE PLEASE![br][size=1]Posted at: December 19, 2006, 06:49:55 PM[/size][hr]I was told to consult my manual, but i dont have 1, any other way?

yes there is… whats ure router… once u found look on on google " (router name here eg belkin) router website

item.title: My comp wont let me do "ULTIMATE SERVER GUIDE" PLEASE HELP MEH!
item.dc:creator: @Imlostru Imlostru
item.description:
@Imlostru wrote:

[quote=“Daelil”]This is from mod taharoks post, ULTIMATE SERVER GUIDE

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

[size=20pt]Ok, a few problems here.
1.I dont know my routers IP adress and it doesent say it
2. Type it in where?
[/size][/quote]

  1. Consult your Router Manuel
  2. type it into your address bar (where you type moparisthebest.com)

Read full topic

item.title: My comp wont let me do "ULTIMATE SERVER GUIDE" PLEASE HELP MEH!
item.dc:creator: @Daelil Daelil
item.description:
@Daelil wrote:

Next, you will need to open ports in Windows Firewall and/or the firewalls offered by McAffee, Norton, or other full-system maintenance suites. For Windows Firewall, open its settings file in the control panel. Click on the “Exceptions Tab” and then click “Add Port.” Add the following port: 43594. (If you’d rather not open a specific port or have to worry about Windows Firewall disabling access in any way, you can disable it entirely.)

[size=20pt]Ok, I have done this, Easy. :)[/size]

Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always

[size=20pt]Ok, a few problems here.
1.I dont know my routers IP adress and it doesent say it
2. Type it in where?
[/size]

KEY
1 = Any name you want the server to be (I.E.MyScape).[/glow]
2 = The IP adddress of your COMPUTER; not the Internet.
Then save it. Ok now you can save settings after the rule is saved. Every router is different. Check with the manuals for yours to fully understand how to open the ports. If you cannot find/have a manuel, go to this address:

Port Forwarding

Now your server rule is nice and good. Now we need Java to get your server’s compiler and runserver to work. You can download the newest java at this link:

JDK 6.0

Ok before we can fix the compiler and runeserver, we need to set out variables. Ok go into start menu, then control panel, then system, then advanced, then enviromental variables.

start menu -> control panel -> system -> advanced -> enviromental variables

[size=20pt]I dont have “system” in my control panel :S[/size]
[br][size=1]Posted at: December 19, 2006, 06:25:35 PM[/size][hr]HELP ME SOMEONE PLEASE![br][size=1]Posted at: December 19, 2006, 06:49:55 PM[/size][hr]I was told to consult my manual, but i dont have 1, any other way?
